name: Thomas Geburt
body: 268 DECEMBER 17, 2020 2020-268 1. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act and paragraph 21 (1 )(a) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council reappoints Johanne Theriault, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020. 2. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act and paragraph 21 (1 )(b) and subsection 21 (4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints the following persons as Vice-Chairs of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020: (a) Bert Cyr, Dieppe, New Brunswick, representing the English language; and (b) Andree Poitras, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, representing the French language. 3. Under subsection 31 (1) of the Education Act and paragraph 21 (1 )(c) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020: (a) Cheryl Richardson, Miramichi, New Brunswick; (b) Ellen Culbert, Woodstock, New Brunswick; and (c) Laurie Laforge, Grand Falls, New Brunswick. 268 -2 4. Under subsection 31 (1) of the Education Act and paragraph 21(1)(d) and subsection 21(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020: (a) Caroline Cormier, Saint John, New Brunswick; (b) Denis-Andre Ward, Caraquet, New Brunswick; and (c) Mylene Broquet, Quispamsis, New Brunswick. 5. Under subsection 31 (1) of the Education Act, subsection 21 (4) and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Thomas Geburt, Oromocto, New Brunswick as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020: 6. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act and subsection 21 (4) and paragraph 21 (1 )(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020: (a) Steeve Savoie, Kedgwick, New Brunswick; and (b) Michel Cote, Dieppe, New Brunswick. Ppr,, Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 17 December 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Secrgtary to Cabinet / Secretaire du Cabinet /eha 6r )0[4/y-

name: Charles Murray
body: 267 DECEMBER 17, 2020 2020-267 Under subsection 4(1) of the Om bud Act and paragraph 21(1)(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Legislative Assembly, reappoints Charles Murray, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Acting Ombud, effective January 1, 2021, for a term of up to one year. Under subsection 31 (1) of the Education Act, subsection 21 (4) and paragraph 21(1)(e) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Thomas Geburt, Oromocto, New Brunswick as a member of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020: 6. Under subsection 31(1) of the Education Act and subsection 21 (4) and paragraph 21 (1 )(f) of New Brunswick Regulation 2004-8, the Teacher Certification Regulation under the Education Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Appeal Board on Teacher Certification to represent the public, for a term of three years, effective December 17, 2020: (a) Steeve Savoie, Kedgwick, New Brunswick; and (b) Michel Cote, Dieppe, New Brunswick. position: Chairman of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board
body: 265 DECEMBER 3, 2020 2020-265 1. Under section 2 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Ryan Donaghy of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as the Commissioner of Municipal Affairs, effective December 3, 2020. 2. Under section 2 of the Control of Municipalities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2020-123 dated June 9, 2020. 3. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Ryan Donaghy of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member and designates him as Chairman of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board, effective December 3, 2020. 4. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Francis Rioux of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board, effective December 3, 2020. 5. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2020-123 dated June 9, 2020. 6. name: Paul Bowman
body: 247 NOVEMBER 26, 2020 2020-247 1. Under paragraph 5(c) and subsections 6(1) and 6(2) of the Midwifery Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Tina Edmond of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Nurses Association of New Brunswick to the Midwifery Council of New Brunswick, for a term of three years, November 26, 2020. 2. Under paragraph 5(e) and subsections 6(1) and 6(2) of the Midwifery Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Heather Bursey of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Department of Health to the Midwifery Council of New Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective November 26, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 5(d) and subsections 6(1) and 6(2) of the Midwifery Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul Bowman of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the New Brunswick College of Pharmacists to the Midwifery Council of New Brunswick, for a term ofthree years, effective February 14, 2021. 4. Under paragraph 5(a) and subsection 6(1) of the Midwifery Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jennifer (Jem) Deguire of Knowlesville, New Brunswick, a registered midwife, to the Midwifery Council of New Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective November 26, 2020. 247 -2 5. Under paragraph 5(b) and subsection 8(1) of the Midwifery Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Dr. Shannon Laity of Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the College of Physicians and Surgeons to the Midwifery Council of New Brunswick, for a term ending August 2, 2022, effective November 26, 2020. name: Mark Reddemann
body: 237 NOVEMBER 12, 2020 2020-237 1. Under subsection 15(6) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the skills and qualifications required of the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation as a whole in order for the board to carry out its functions, and the skills and qualification requirements for nominees for the board of directors positions to be filled. 2. Under paragraph 15(7)(c) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used by the board of directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation in making nominations and the results of those processes. 3. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsections 15(3) and (5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following individuals as directors of the board of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective November 12, 2020: a) Mark Reddemann of Scottsdale, Arizona, USA, for a term of four years; b) Scott Northard of Hastings, Minnesota, USA, for a term of two years. 4. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 15(8) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as directors of the board of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, effective November 12, 2020: a) Barbara Trenholm of Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of one year; - 2 - 237 b) Paul McCoy of Western Springs, Illinois, USA, for a term of three years; c) Judith Athaide of Calgary, Alberta, for a term of one year; and d) Alain Bosse of St. Quentin, New Brunswick, for a term of four years. 5. Under subsections 16(1) and (2) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Charles (Chuck) Firlotte of Shelton, Connecticut, USA, as Chair of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, for a term of five years, effective November 12, 2020. 6. Under paragraph 15(2)(b) and subsection 16(1) of the Electricity Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2019-34 dated February 28, 2019. 7. Under to paragraph 15(2)(b) of the Electricity Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 3(a) of Order in Council 2019-34 dated February 28, 2019. <.l r%, Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 12 November 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le of Clerk the Executive Council/Greffier du Conseil executif /ate.cs.e,_o -/ 7o\@Ky

body: 238 NOVEMBER 12, 2020 2020-238 Under paragraph 8(1)(c) and subsections 8(3) and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, effective November 12, 2020: a) Andrew McLaughlin, Dieppe, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; b) Daniella Degrace, Saint John, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; c) Gilles Cormier, Riverview, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; d) Andree Savoie, Dieppe, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; and e) Andrea Feunekes, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. s..Y d Brenda L. name: Andrea Leger
body: 228 NOVEMBER 5, 2020 2020-228 1. Under section 6 of the Municipal Elections Act, section 36.3 of the Education Act and section 11 of New Brunswick Regulation 2012-7, the Board Regulation - Regional Health Authorities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Andrea Leger, Cocagne, New Brunswick, as municipal returning officer for M05 Kent-Westmorland, effective November 5, 2020, for the 2021 municipal general elections, as well as any by-elections for municipalities that may be required in their respective region. 2. Under to section 6 of the Municipal Elections Act, section 36.3 of the Education Act, section 11 of New Brunswick Regulation 2012-7, the Board Regulation - Regional Health Authorities Act, and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 2(e) of Order in Council 2019-259, dated December 19, 2019. name: Cade Libby
position: Deputy Minister of Environment and Climate Change
body: 200 OCTOBER 1, 2020 2020-200 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Mike Comeau as Deputy Minister of Justice and Public Safety and Deputy Attorney General, effective October 1, 2020, in place of John Logan. 2. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Deputy Minister of Environment and Climate Change, effective October 1, 2020. 3. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Ryan Donaghy as Acting Deputy Minister of Local Government and Local Governance Reform, effective October 1, 2020. 4. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sadie Perron as Deputy Minister of Aboriginal Affairs, effective October 1, 2020, in place of Cade Libby. 5. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends section 2 of Order in Council 2020-35 dated February 13, 2020 by removing the word "Acting" where it appears therein. 200 -2 - 6. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends section 7 of Order in Council 2019-224 dated November 7, 2019 by removing the word "Acting" where it appears therein. 7. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2020-109 dated May 26, 2020. ±d82 Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le October 1, 2020. name: Jill Green
body: 193 SEPTEMBRE 29, 2020 2020-193 Under section 2 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant Governor appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective September 29, 2020: (a) The Honourable Blaine Higgs, Premier and President of the Executive Council; (b) The Honourable Margaret Johnson, Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries; (c) The Honourable Dominic Cardy, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development; (d) The Honourable Ernie Steeves, Minister of Finance and Treasury Board; (e) The Honourable Dorothy Shephard, Minister of Health; (f) The Honourable Trevor Holder, Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour; (g) The Honourable Mary Wilson, Minister of Service New Brunswick; (h) The Honourable Bruce Fitch, Minister of Social Development; 193 - 2 - (i) The Honourable Tammy Scott-Wallace Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture; (j) The Honourable Jill Green, Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure; and (k) The Honourable Arlene Dunn, Minister of Aboriginal Affairs. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 29 September 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Secretary to Cabinet / Secretaire du Cabinet pate. body: 193 SEPTEMBRE 29, 2020 2020-193 Under section 2 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant Governor appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective September 29, 2020: (a) The Honourable Blaine Higgs, Premier and President of the Executive Council; (b) The Honourable Margaret Johnson, Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries; (c) The Honourable Dominic Cardy, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development; (d) The Honourable Ernie Steeves, Minister of Finance and Treasury Board; (e) The Honourable Dorothy Shephard, Minister of Health; (f) The Honourable Trevor Holder, Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour; (g) The Honourable Mary Wilson, Minister of Service New Brunswick; (h) The Honourable Bruce Fitch, Minister of Social Development; 193 - 2 - (i) The Honourable Tammy Scott-Wallace Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture; (j) The Honourable Jill Green, Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure; and (k) The Honourable Arlene Dunn, Minister of Aboriginal Affairs. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 29 September 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Secretary to Cabinet / Secretaire du Cabinet pate. name: Arlene Dunn
body: 193 SEPTEMBRE 29, 2020 2020-193 Under section 2 of the Executive Council Act, the Lieutenant Governor appoints under the Great Seal of the Province, from among the members of the Executive Council, the following Ministers who shall hold office during pleasure, effective September 29, 2020: (a) The Honourable Blaine Higgs, Premier and President of the Executive Council; (b) The Honourable Margaret Johnson, Minister of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries; (c) The Honourable Dominic Cardy, Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development; (d) The Honourable Ernie Steeves, Minister of Finance and Treasury Board; (e) The Honourable Dorothy Shephard, Minister of Health; (f) The Honourable Trevor Holder, Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour; (g) The Honourable Mary Wilson, Minister of Service New Brunswick; (h) The Honourable Bruce Fitch, Minister of Social Development; 193 - 2 - (i) The Honourable Tammy Scott-Wallace Minister of Tourism, Heritage and Culture; (j) The Honourable Jill Green, Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure; and (k) The Honourable Arlene Dunn, Minister of Aboriginal Affairs. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 29 September 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Secretary to Cabinet / Secretaire du Cabinet pate. name: Denis Mallet
body: 178 AUGUST 12, 2020 2020-178 1. Under paragraph 6(2)(f) of the Universite de Moncton Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Denis Mallet, Shippagan, New Brunswick, to the Board of Governors of the Universite de Moncton, as a member representing the North East region of the province, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020. 2. Under paragraph 6(2)(f) of the Universite de Moncton Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Mireille Vautour, Edmundston, New Brunswick, to the Board of Governors of the Universite de Moncton, as a member representing the North West region of the province, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 6(2)(g) of the Universite de Moncton Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Etiennette Bosse, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the Universite de Moncton, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020. name: Giselle Price
body: 183 AUGUST 12, 2020 2020-183 1. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, for a term of three years: (a) Giselle Price, Fredericton, New Brunswick, from Region 9, effective November 14, 2020; and (b) Michael Blanchard, Bath, New Brunswick, from Region 11, effective August 12, 2020. 2. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as alternate members of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020: (a) Angela Breau Caissie, Cocagne, New Brunswick, from Region 2;and (b) Yvon Albert, St. Stephen, New Brunswick, from Region 8. 3. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Steven Frits, Lower Millstream, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board from Region 7, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020. - 2 184 4. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Christine Couturier, Dieppe, New Brunswick as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board from Region 1, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020. 5. Under subsection 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 10 of Order in Council 2019-108 dated June 6, 2019. %%pr{ Brenda L. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as alternate members of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020: (a) Angela Breau Caissie, Cocagne, New Brunswick, from Region 2;and (b) Yvon Albert, St. Stephen, New Brunswick, from Region 8. 3. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Steven Frits, Lower Millstream, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board from Region 7, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020. - 2 184 4. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Christine Couturier, Dieppe, New Brunswick as an alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board from Region 1, for a term of three years, effective August 12, 2020. 5. Under subsection 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 10 of Order in Council 2019-108 dated June 6, 2019. %%pr{ Brenda L. name: Amanda Mitchell
body: 159 JULY 8, 2020 2020-159 1. Under paragraph 31 (1 )(d) and subsection 32(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council declares that the rural community of Campobello Island is subject to the provisions of Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act. 2. Under subsections 32(1) and 33(1) of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Richard (Dick) Isabelle, Gagetown, New Brunswick, as the Supervisor of the rural community of Campobello Island and vests in the Supervisor all of those powers conferred upon a Supervisor pursuant to Part V of the Control of Municipalities Act. 3. Under section 44 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council gives approval for Richard (Dick) Isabelle, Supervisor of the rural community of Campobello Island, to take full charge and control over all money belonging to the rural community of Campobello Island and received by any person for or on its behalf, and to sign all cheques drawn and issued by the rural community of Campobello Island; and gives approval to Richard (Dick) Isabelle to authorize Amanda Mitchell, Clerk and Treasurer, rural community of Campobello Island, to countersign all cheques drawn and issued by the rural community of Campobello Island. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 8 July 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Secretary o Ctabinet / Secretaire du Cabinet lson Ply bats

position: member of the Board of Governors
body: 160 JULY 8, 2020 2020-160 1. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, nominated by the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, effective July 8, 2020, for a term ending July 1, 2023: (a) Kathryn Edwards, Dieppe, New Brunswick; (b) Rick Hancox, Rothesay, New Brunswick; and (c) Catherine Lawrence, Mactaquac, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11 (1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michael Walsh, Miramichi, New Brunswick, to the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, nominated by the Minister, effective July 8, 2020, for a term ending July 1, 2023. 3. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Elizabeth Watters-Gray, Perth-Andover, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, nominated by the Minister, effective July 8, 2020, for a term ending July 1, 2023. 160 - 2 4. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2018-204 dated June 6, 2018. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, nominated by the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, effective July 8, 2020, for a term ending July 1, 2023: (a) Kathryn Edwards, Dieppe, New Brunswick; (b) Rick Hancox, Rothesay, New Brunswick; and (c) Catherine Lawrence, Mactaquac, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11 (1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Michael Walsh, Miramichi, New Brunswick, to the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, nominated by the Minister, effective July 8, 2020, for a term ending July 1, 2023. 3. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Elizabeth Watters-Gray, Perth-Andover, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Governors of the New Brunswick Community College, nominated by the Minister, effective July 8, 2020, for a term ending July 1, 2023. 160 - 2 4. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2018-204 dated June 6, 2018. name: Steve Lambert
body: 124 JUNE 16, 2020 2020-124 1. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Denis Nadeau, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as a member to the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective July 1, 2020. 2. Under paragraph 9(3)(a) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Rejean Boudreau, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member to the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Board of Governors, for a term of three years, effective July 1, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11 (1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Hermel Vienneau, Petit Rocher, New Brunswick, as a member to the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour, for a term of three years, effective July 1, 2020. 4. Under paragraph 9(3)(b) and subsection 11(1) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Steve Lambert, Campbellton, New Brunswick, as a member to the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau Brunswick, as a person nominated by the Minister of Post-Secondary Education, Training and Labour, for a term of three years, effective July 1, 2020. 124 -2 - 5. Under paragraph 9(3)(c) and subsection and 11(2) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sonia Chiasson, Village Blanchard, New Brunswick, to the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick as the student nominated by the students, for a term of two years, effective July 1, 2020. 6. Under paragraph 9(3)(d) and subsection 11 (8) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Violette Desjardins, Campbellton, New Brunswick, to the Board of Governors of the College communautaire du Nouveau-Brunswick as the non-academic staff person nominated by its non-academic staff, for a term ending June 29, 2022. 7. Under paragraph 9(3)(d) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2019-109 dated June 6, 2019. 8. Under paragraph 9(3)(e) and subsections 9(2) and 11 (2) of the New Brunswick Community Colleges Act and section 26 ofthe Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2019-163 dated September 9, 2019. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 16 June 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le Secretary to Cabinet / Secretaire du Cabinet g' c c. brg o- c 3/Ju Jr =. ?)

name: Traci Simmonds
body: 123 JUNE 9, 2020 2020-123 1. Under section 2 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom MacFarlane as Commissioner of Municipal Affairs, effective June 9, 2020. 2. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom MacFarlane as a member and designates him as Chairman of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board, effective June 9, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsection 9(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sadie Perron as a member of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective June 9, 2020. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Traci Simmonds as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective June 9, 2020. 5. Under section 2 ofthe Control of Municipalities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2018-103 dated March 21, 2018. 6. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2014-450 dated December 19, 2014. 123 - 2 7. Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 1 (b) of Order in Council 2019-181 dated October 3, 2019. 8. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 3(a) of Order in Council 2012-94 dated March 14, 2012. 9. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 1(f) of Order in Council 2015-239 dated October 7, 2015. 10. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council revokes section 3 of Order in Council 2018-45 dated January 30, 2018. • .7 Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 9 June 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le

Under subsection 2(2) of the Coroners Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council reappoints the following individuals as coroners, for a term three years: (a) Tracy Beal, Doaktown, New Brunswick, effective August 9, 2020; (b) Emily Caissy, Campbellton, New Brunswick, effective August 9, 2020; (c) John Evans, Fredericton, New Brunswick, effective July 13, 2020; (d) Jonathan Fulljames, Rossville, New Brunswick, effective August 3, 2020; (e) Douglas Wayne Getty, Bryenton, New Brunswick, effective August 3, 2020; (f) Pierrette Hache, Bertrand, New Brunswick, effective August 9, 2020; (g) Robert S. Hart, Bas Cap-Pele, effective August 28, 2020; (h) Robert W. Hewitson, Moncton, New Brunswick, effective December 22, 2020; (i) Paul F. McCarthy, Fredericton, New Brunswick, effective December 22, 2020; and (j) Robert W. Moore, Moncton, New Brunswick, effective August 29, 2020. 2. Under subsection 2(2) of the Coroners Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2010-409 dated August 12, 2010. 119 - 2 3. Under subsection 2(2) of the Coroners Act and section 26 ofthe Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2013-274 dated September 4, 2013. 4. Under subsection 2(2) of the Coroners Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2013-186 dated June 20, 2013. Brenda L. name: Tom MacFarlane
position: Chairman of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board
body: 123 JUNE 9, 2020 2020-123 1. Under section 2 of the Control of Municipalities Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom MacFarlane as Commissioner of Municipal Affairs, effective June 9, 2020. 2. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Tom MacFarlane as a member and designates him as Chairman of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Board, effective June 9, 2020. 3. Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsection 9(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Sadie Perron as a member of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective June 9, 2020. 4. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Traci Simmonds as a member of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of three years, effective June 9, 2020. 5. Under section 2 ofthe Control of Municipalities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes Order in Council 2018-103 dated March 21, 2018. 6. Under subsection 2(1) of the Municipal Capital Borrowing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 1 of Order in Council 2014-450 dated December 19, 2014. 123 - 2 7. Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 1 (b) of Order in Council 2019-181 dated October 3, 2019. 8. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 3(a) of Order in Council 2012-94 dated March 14, 2012. 9. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraph 1(f) of Order in Council 2015-239 dated October 7, 2015. 10. Under subsections 3(1) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council revokes section 3 of Order in Council 2018-45 dated January 30, 2018. • .7 Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the 9 June 2020. de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le

name: George Lacey
body: 113 JUNE 2, 2020 2020-113 1. Under subsections 4(1) and 4(3) of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following individuals as members of the Board of Examiners for Power Engineers, for a term ending May 23, 2023: (a) Krista Parker, Pennfield, New Brunswick; and (b) Roger Pelletier, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under subsections 4(1) and 4(3) of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following individuals as members of the Board of Examiners for Power Engineers, for a term ending May 23, 2023: (a) Kirby O'Donnell, New Bandon, New Brunswick; and ( b) George Lacey, Queenstown, New Brunswick. 3. Under subsections 4(1), 4(2) and 4(3) of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Eben Creaser, Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as a member and designates him Chair of the Board of Examiners for Power Engineers, for a term ending May 23, s.4-7y 2023: Brenda L. name: Chad Maclean
position: members of the Board of Examiners for Compressed Gas
body: 112 JUNE 2, 2020 2020-112 1. Under subsections 28(1) and (3) of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Board of Examiners for Compressed Gas, for a term ending May 23, 2023: (a) Chris Snow, Saint John, New Brunswick; (b) Anthony Wilkins, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (c) David Evans, Upper Golden Grove, New Brunswick; and (d) Chad Maclean, Hillsborough, New Brunswick. 2. Under subsections 28(1 ), (2) and (3) of the Boiler and Pressure Vessel Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michael Davidson, Rusagonis, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of Examiners for Compressed Gas and designates him Chair, for a term ending May 23, 2023. name: Roger Senechal
position: members of the Family Income Security Appeal Board
body: 106 MAY 19, 2020 2020-106 1. Under subsections 24(1) and 24(2) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-61, the General Regulation under the Family Income Security Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Family Income Security Appeal Board, for a term of three years, effective May 19, 2020: (a) Jason Godin, Caraquet, New Brunswick, Vice-Chair; (b) Sharon Tucker, St. George, New Brunswick; (c) Melanie Burns, Saint John, New Brunswick; (d) Mark Fisher, Saint John, New Brunswick; (e) Sherry MacEachern, Moncton, New Brunswick; and (f) Chris Maxwell, Sackville, New Brunswick. 2. Under subsections 24(1) and 24(2) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-61, the General Regulation under the Family Income Security Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Family Income Security Appeal Board, for a term of three years, effective May 19, 2020: (a) Roger Senechal, Beresford, New Brunswick; (b) Wilma Gilchrist, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (c) Jami Moore, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (d) Terry Ogilvie, Salisbury, New Brunswick; (e) James Proudfoot, Moncton, New Brunswick; and (f) Zara Morrison, Picadilly, New Brunswick. 106 -2 3. Under subsections 24(1) of New Brunswick Regulation 95-61, the General Regulation under the Family Income Security Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 5 of Order in Council 2018-67, February 22, 2018. 6.22}--r Brenda L. body: 101 MAY 14, 2020 2020-101 Under subsections 3(1), 3(2) and 3(4) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Rebecca Moffatt, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, as a member, and appoints her as President of The Board of the New Brunswick Museum, for a term ending May 13, 2023. name: Kelli Simmonds
body: 102 MAY 14, 2020 2020-102 1. Under subsections 20.1 { 1} and 20.1 (2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal, for a term of five years, effective May 28, 2020. 2. Under subsection 20.3(1} of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council fixes the remuneration for the Chairperson of the Workers' Compensation Appeals Tribunal at a rate equivalent to Step D, Level I of the Deputy Head Pay Plan, effective May 28, 2020. name: Mario Caissie
body: 95 APRIL 30, 2020 2020-95 1. Under paragraph 8(1 )(c) and subsections 8(3), and 9(1) of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members to the board of directors fo Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of one year, effective April 30, 2020: (a) James Baumgartner, Naples, Florida; (b) Mario Caissie, Moncton, New Brunswick; (c) Michael J. Campbell, Florenceville, New Brunswick; (d) Lily Durepos, Grand Falls, New Brunswick; and (e) Chantal Theriault, Saint-Basile, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 8(1 )(c) and subsections 8(3), 9(1) and section 10 of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Derek G. Pannell, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the board of directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of six months, effective April 30, 2020. 3. Under section 10 of the Opportunities New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Mario Caissie, Moncton, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the board of directors of Opportunities New Brunswick, for a term of one year, effective April 30, 2020. name: Keith Cronkhite
body: 65 MARCH 12, 2020 2020-65 1. Under subsection 23(6) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of the skills and qualification requirements for nominees for the position of President and Chief Executive Officer of the New Brunswick Power Corporation. 2. Under paragraph 23(7)(c) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council acknowledges receipt of a description of the recruitment, assessment and selection processes used in making nominations for the position of President and Chief Executive Officer of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, and the results of the processes. 3. Under subsections 23(1) and 23(2) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Keith Cronkhite, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as President and Chief Executive Officer of the New Brunswick Power Corporation, from among persons nominated by the board of directors ofthe New Brunswick Power Corporation, for a term ofthree years, effective April 1, 2020. 4. Under subsections 23(4) and 23(5) of the Electricity Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council determines the annual remuneration of the President and Chief Executive Officer of the New Brunswick Power Corporation to be $450,000.00 44 l Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 12 March 2020. Secretary to Cabinet / Secretaire du Cabinet latc Kg, buoo

name: Brenda L. Murphy
body: 54 MARCH 9, 2020 2020-54 Under subsection 15(1) of the Elections Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council directs that a writ of election for the electoral district of Shediac Bay-Dieppe be issued on the 12 day of May, 2020, and be returnable on the 26 day of June, 2020; that the 29 day of May, 2020 at 2:00 p.m. be appointed as the day for nomination of candidates; that the 6 and 8 days of June, 2020 be appointed as advanced polling days; that the 19 day of June, 2020 be appointed as the day candidates are declared elected; and that the 15 day of June, 2020, be appointed polling day. AND the Executive Council concurring in said Recommendation. IT IS ACCORDINGLY SO ORDERED. Brenda L. Murhpy Lieutnant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 9 March 2020. Secretary to Cabinet /_Secretaire du Cabinet {ice. fon- n\Ky? BY HER HONOUR, BRENDA L. MURPHY LIEUTENANT-GOVERNOR OF NEW BRUNSWICK PROCLAMATION WHEREAS under subsection 15(1) of the Elections Act, a by election is necessary in the electoral district of Shediac Bay-Dieppe; AND whereas I have thought fit to order and direct that a writ of election for the electoral district of Shediac Bay-Dieppe be issued; Public Notice is hereby given that a writ of election for the electoral district of Sheidac Bay-Dieppe be issued on the 12 day of May, 2020, and be returnable on the 26 day of June, 2020; that the 29 day of May, 2020 at 2:00 p.m. be appointed as the day for nomination of candidates; that the 6 and 8 days of June, 2020 be appointed as advanced polling days; that the 19 day of June, 2020 be appointed as the day candidates are declared elected; and that the 15 day of June, 2020, be appointed polling day. Given under my hand and the Great Seal of the Province at Fredericton on the 9 day of March, in the year of our Lord Two Thousand and Twenty and in the sixty-ninth year of Her Majesty's reign. • < > IEUTENANT-GOVERNOR Brenda L. Murphy Attorney General Lieutenant-Governor

Under subsections 4(3) and 6(5) and paragraph 4(1 ){g) of the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Debra Romero, Ripples, New Brunswick, as chair of the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Board, for a term ending February 10, 2023. 2. Under subsection 6(1) and paragraphs 4(1 ){a) and 4{2){a) of the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons to the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Board as members representing employers, for a term of three years, effective February 13, 2020: {a) Scott Toner, Tracadie-Sheila, New Brunswick; and {b) Shirley Mitchell, Saint John, New Brunswick. 3. Under subsection 6(1) and paragraphs 4(1)(a) and 4{2){a) of the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Mark Thibodeau, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, to the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Board as a member representing employers, for a term ofthree years, effective February 13, 2020. 4. Under subsection 6(1) and paragraphs 4(1 ){b) and 4{2){a) of the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons to the Apprenticeship and Occupational Certification Board as members representing employees, for a term of three years, effective February 13, 2020: {a) Lura Fowler, Willow Grove, New Brunswick; and {b) Meagan Wood, Saint John, New Brunswick. -2 34 5. name: O'Neil Arseneau
body: 259 DECEMBER 19, 2019 2019-259 1. Under section 6 of the Municipal Elections Act, section 36.3 of the Education Act, section 11 of N.B. Regulation 2012-7, the Board Regulation - Regional Health Authorities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2015-292 dated December 17, 2015 and section 2 of Order in Council 2016-3 dated January 12, 2016, effective December 19, 2019. 2. Under section 6 of the Municipal Elections Act, section 36.3 of the Education Act, and section 11 of New Brunswick Regulation 2012-7, the Board Regulation- Regional Health Authorities Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints the following persons as municipal returning officers, for the 2020 municipal general elections, as well as any by-elections for municipalities that may be required in their respective regions, effective December 19, 2019: (a) Richard Ayles, Campbellton, New Brunswick, Region M01 Restigouche; (b) Mark Guindon, Bathurst, New Brunswick, Region M02 Bathurst and Area; (c) Delcia Cool, Le Goulet, New Brunswick, Region M03 Acadian Peninsula; (d) Cyril Donahue, Miramichi, New Brunswick, Region M04 Northumberland; (e) Clarence Melanson, St-Antoine Sud, New Brunswick, Region M05 Kent-Westmorland; (f) Tanya Cooper, Hillsborough, New Brunswick, Region M06 Albert-Westmorland; (g) O'Neil Arseneau, Dieppe, New Brunswick, M07 Moncton; (h) Victorine Robichaud, Rothesay, New Brunswick, MOS King- Queens; 259 - 2 (i) Terry Totten, Saint John, New Brunswick, M09 Saint John; (j) Mary Casement, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, M10 Charlotte; (k) Patti Nason, Tracy, New Brunswick, M11 Queens-Sunbury-York; (I) Blake Kennedy, Rusagonis, New Brunswick, M12 Fredericton; (m) Lori Ann Tweedie, Williamstown, New Brunswick, M13 Carleton- Victoria; and (n) Lore-Ann Carroll, St-Leonard-Parent, New Brunswick, M14 Madawaska. Brenda L. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act and paragraph 21 (1(b) of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Marc Leger, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a part-time member and vice-chair of the New Brunswick Police Commission, effective May 18, 2020, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsections 18(1) and 18(2) of the Police Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2018-254 dated July 4, 2018. Brenda L. name: Jean-Marc Dupuis
body: 224 NOVEMBE7R, 2019 2019-224 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jean-Marc Dupuis as Secretary to Cabinet, effective September 16, 2019, in place of Judy Wagner. 2. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kelly Cain as Deputy Minister of Intergovernmental Affairs, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Héléne Bouchard. 3. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Marcel Lavoie as Deputy Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development (Francophone), effective November 12, 2019, in place of Gérald Richard. 4. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints George Daley as Deputy Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development (Anglophone), effective November 12, 2019, in place of John McLaughlin. 5. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gérald Richard as Deputy Minister of Health, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Tom Maston. 224 6: Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Acting Deputy Minister of Aboriginal Affairs, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Judy Wagner. the Under section 3 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Acting President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Héléne Bouchard. 8. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John P. Logan, as Acting Deputy Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Kelly Cian. 9. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends section 3 of Order in Council 2017-304 dated November 22, 2017, by striking out the word “Acting” where it appears therein. ante Mpty Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 7 November 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet Piliuia, Gun Okénpe

name: Allison Walker
position: Chair of the Board of Directors
body: 200 OCTOBER 31, 2019 2019-200 ‘Is Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective October 31, 2019: (a) Juan Estepa, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (b) lan G. Stead, Saint John, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (c) | Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; and (d) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. 2} Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective December 7, 2019: (a) | Janice Allen-Scott, Scotch Settlement, New Brunswick; and (b) Karl Clancey, Saint John, New Brunswick. 200 3. Under subsection 3(8) of the Kings Landing Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints (a) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of two years, effective October 31, 2019; and; (b) | Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Vice- Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective December 7, 2019, for a term to expire October 30, 2021. A Yep Brenda L. Stead, Saint John, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (c) | Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; and (d) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. 2} Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective December 7, 2019: (a) | Janice Allen-Scott, Scotch Settlement, New Brunswick; and (b) Karl Clancey, Saint John, New Brunswick. 200 3. name: Hector Losier
body: 182 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-182 1. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b), 8(1.03)(a), and subsection 8(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following individuals, as worker representatives on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Hector Losier, Fredericton, New Brunswick; and (b) James Stanley, Saint John, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraphs 8(1)(c) , 8(1.03)(b) and subsection 8(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Lucien Sonier, Caraquet, New Brunswick, as an employer representative on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. Puasts Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Cathy LaRochelle
body: 181 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-181 al, Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton New Brunswick; and (b) Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Annette Comeau, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) David Rogers, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Meaghan Seagrave, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Irene McCardle, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; and (e) Dr. Levi Hargrove, Chicago, Illionois, United States of America, for a term of two years. 181 3 Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1), 9(2) and 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Shelley Rinehart, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. 4. Under subsection 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Janet Gagnon, Fredericton New Brunswick, as a member and Vice-Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019, for a term ending June 19, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

body: 181 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-181 al, Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton New Brunswick; and (b) Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Annette Comeau, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) David Rogers, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Meaghan Seagrave, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Irene McCardle, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; and (e) Dr. Levi Hargrove, Chicago, Illionois, United States of America, for a term of two years. 181 3 Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1), 9(2) and 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Shelley Rinehart, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. 4. Under subsection 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Janet Gagnon, Fredericton New Brunswick, as a member and Vice-Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019, for a term ending June 19, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Frangois Breton
body: 177 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-177 1. Under section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following employees of the Laboratory in Scientific Services Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency as provincial analysts, for a term of five years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Alina M. Anghel, Ottawa, Ontario; (b) | Frangois Breton, Ottawa, Ontario; (c) Cindy Carrier, Ottawa, Ontario; (d) Jessica Diano, Nepean, Ontario; (e) | Camilo Augusto Quintero, Ottawa, Ontario; (f) Kara Rutter Swiecki, Ottawa, Ontario; and (g) | Dorthy Vernon, Ottawa, Ontario. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following paragraphs of Order in Council 2010-254 dated May 13, 2010: (a) subparagraph 2(a)(i); (b) subparagraph 2(a)(iii); (c) subparagraph 2(a)(v); (d) subparagraph 2(a)(vi); (e) subparagraph 2(a)(vii); and (f) paragraph 2(b); Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy retary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet ‘eliwces atu MP Keeps 177 2. En vertu de l'article 26 de la Loi d'interprétation et de l'article 182.1 de la Loi sur la réglementation des alcools, le lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil révoque les alinéas et sous-alinéas suivants du décret en conseil 2010- 254 pris le 13 mai 2010: a) sous-alinéa 2a)(i); b) sous-alinéa 2a)(iii); c) sous-alinéa 2a)(v); d) sous-alinéa 2a)(vi); e) sous-alinéa 2a)(vii); et f) alinéa 2b). La lieutenante-gouverneure, Renate Maroy Brenda L. Murphy This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 octobre 2019. en to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet thiten Lrewn NKh ye

name: Alina M. Anghel
body: 177 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-177 1. Under section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following employees of the Laboratory in Scientific Services Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency as provincial analysts, for a term of five years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Alina M. Anghel, Ottawa, Ontario; (b) | Frangois Breton, Ottawa, Ontario; (c) Cindy Carrier, Ottawa, Ontario; (d) Jessica Diano, Nepean, Ontario; (e) | Camilo Augusto Quintero, Ottawa, Ontario; (f) Kara Rutter Swiecki, Ottawa, Ontario; and (g) | Dorthy Vernon, Ottawa, Ontario. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following paragraphs of Order in Council 2010-254 dated May 13, 2010: (a) subparagraph 2(a)(i); (b) subparagraph 2(a)(iii); (c) subparagraph 2(a)(v); (d) subparagraph 2(a)(vi); (e) subparagraph 2(a)(vii); and (f) paragraph 2(b); Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy retary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet ‘eliwces atu MP Keeps 177 2. En vertu de l'article 26 de la Loi d'interprétation et de l'article 182.1 de la Loi sur la réglementation des alcools, le lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil révoque les alinéas et sous-alinéas suivants du décret en conseil 2010- 254 pris le 13 mai 2010: a) sous-alinéa 2a)(i); b) sous-alinéa 2a)(iii); c) sous-alinéa 2a)(v); d) sous-alinéa 2a)(vi); e) sous-alinéa 2a)(vii); et f) alinéa 2b). La lieutenante-gouverneure, Renate Maroy Brenda L. name: Libby Macdonald
body: 179 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-179 ‘As Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2), 4(3) and 4(4) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as directors of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, effective October 3, 2019, for a term to end March 30, 2021: (a) Leanne Murray, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (b) | Jim Mehan, Quispamsis, New Brunswick; and (c) Libby Macdonald, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 1, 4 and 8 of Order in Council 2018-95 dated March 21, 2018. Bente Wonpty- Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. ON Nebae, to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Dorthy Vernon
body: 177 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-177 1. Under section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following employees of the Laboratory in Scientific Services Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency as provincial analysts, for a term of five years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Alina M. Anghel, Ottawa, Ontario; (b) | Frangois Breton, Ottawa, Ontario; (c) Cindy Carrier, Ottawa, Ontario; (d) Jessica Diano, Nepean, Ontario; (e) | Camilo Augusto Quintero, Ottawa, Ontario; (f) Kara Rutter Swiecki, Ottawa, Ontario; and (g) | Dorthy Vernon, Ottawa, Ontario. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following paragraphs of Order in Council 2010-254 dated May 13, 2010: (a) subparagraph 2(a)(i); (b) subparagraph 2(a)(iii); (c) subparagraph 2(a)(v); (d) subparagraph 2(a)(vi); (e) subparagraph 2(a)(vii); and (f) paragraph 2(b); Brenda L. name: New Brunswick Multicultural Association
body: 176 SEPTEMBER 26, 2019 2019-176 1. Under paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsections 5(2) and 7(1) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following members to the New Brunswick Women’s Council: (a) New Brunswick Aboriginal People’s Council, as a member organization, represented by Amanda LeBlanc, Welsford, New Brunswick, effective September 26, 2019, for a term to expire on May 31, 2020; (b) YWCA Moncton, as a member organization, represented by Michéle Nadeau, Shediac, New Brunswick, effective September 26, 2019, for a term to expire on May 31, 2020; and (c) New Brunswick Multicultural Association, as a member organization, represented by Myriam Mekni, Riverview, New Brunswick, effective September 26, 2019, for a term to expire on May 31, 2020. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and paragraph 5(1)(c) and subsection 5(2) of the New Brunswick Women’s Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes: (a) Section (2) of Order in Council 2018-3, dated January 2, 2018; (b) Paragraph (j) of Order in Council 2017-105, dated May 4, 2017; and (c) Paragraph (m) of Order in Council 2017-105, dated May 4, 2017. Aneel Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 26 September 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet OMieix Guown-

name: Sara Jean Berry
body: 168 SEPTEMBER 12, 2019 2019-168 1 Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 8(3) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jennifer Cleversey Moffitt, Bathurst, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Tribunal for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6), for a term of five year term, effective September 12, 2019. 2. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 8(3) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Louise Caissie, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Tribunal for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7), for a term of five year term, effective September 12, 2019. 3. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1) and 8(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation - Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sara Jean Berry, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Tribunal for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7), for a term of five year term, effective September 12, 2019. Brenda L. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 8(3) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Louise Caissie, Saint John, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Tribunal for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7), for a term of five year term, effective September 12, 2019. 3. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1) and 8(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation - Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Sara Jean Berry, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Tribunal for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7), for a term of five year term, effective September 12, 2019. name: Robert G. Landry
body: 164 SEPTEMBER 9, 2019 2019-164 1. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Board of the New Brunswick Museum, effective September 9, 2019 (a) Derek Cooke, St. Stephen, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) Katie Bowden, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Shawn McCarthy, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Stephany Peterson, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; William Forrestall, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; Chief Hugh Akagi, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; Catherine Isabel Eddy, Bathurst, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. 2. Under subsections 3(1), (2) and (4) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Kathryn Hamer Edwards, Sackville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of the New Brunswick Museum, for a term of two years, effective September 9, 2019. 3. Under subsections 3(1), (2) and (4) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert G. Landry, Caraquet, New Brunswick as a member, and appoints him as President of the Board of the New Brunswick Museum, for a term of six months, effective September 9, 2019. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 9 September 2019. name: Marianne Mallia
body: 153 SEPTEMBER 9, 2019 2019-153 1. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons to the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board of Trustees: (a) Mel Parker, Campbellton, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective September 9, 2019; (b) Tim Ringuette, Saint John, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective September 9, 2019; (c) Charlaine Gauthier, Moncton, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019; (d) Barbara Jessome, Edmundston, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019; and (e) Bernard Bourque, Wilson's Beach, New Brunswick, trustee representing the New Brunswick Public Libraries Board, effective September 9, 2019, for a term ending March 31, 2021. 2. Under subsection 7(3) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates Marianne Mallia, Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, effective September 9, 2019 for a term ending June 5, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 9 septembre 2019. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons to the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board of Trustees: (a) Mel Parker, Campbellton, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective September 9, 2019; (b) Tim Ringuette, Saint John, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective September 9, 2019; (c) Charlaine Gauthier, Moncton, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019; (d) Barbara Jessome, Edmundston, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019; and (e) Bernard Bourque, Wilson's Beach, New Brunswick, trustee representing the New Brunswick Public Libraries Board, effective September 9, 2019, for a term ending March 31, 2021. 2. Under subsection 7(3) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates Marianne Mallia, Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, effective September 9, 2019 for a term ending June 5, 2021. Brenda L. body: 164 SEPTEMBER 9, 2019 2019-164 1. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as members of the Board of the New Brunswick Museum, effective September 9, 2019 (a) Derek Cooke, St. Stephen, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) Katie Bowden, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Shawn McCarthy, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Stephany Peterson, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; William Forrestall, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; Chief Hugh Akagi, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; Catherine Isabel Eddy, Bathurst, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. 2. Under subsections 3(1), (2) and (4) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Kathryn Hamer Edwards, Sackville, New Brunswick, as a member of the Board of the New Brunswick Museum, for a term of two years, effective September 9, 2019. 3. Under subsections 3(1), (2) and (4) of the New Brunswick Museum Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Robert G. Landry, Caraquet, New Brunswick as a member, and appoints him as President of the Board of the New Brunswick Museum, for a term of six months, effective September 9, 2019. Brenda L. name: Patrick Parent
body: 149 JULY 23, 2019 2019-149 1. Under subsection 9(1) of the New Brunswick Liquor Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patrick Parent, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as President of the New Brunswick Liquor Corporation, for a term of five years, effective September 3, 2019. 2. Under subsection 9(4) and 9(5) of the New Brunswick Liquor Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Board of Directors of the New Brunswick Liquor Corporation, determines that the remuneration of the President of the New Brunswick Liquor Corporation be set at $240,000 per annum, effective September 3, 2019. name: Sadie Perron
body: 136 JULY 16, 2019 2019-136 1. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as Directors of the Regional Development Corporation, effective July 16, 2019: (a) Helene Bouchard, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (b) Cheryl Hansen, Fredericton, New Brunswick; and (c) Sadie Perron, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1 )(a) of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Thomas MacFarlane, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective July 16, 2019. 3. Under section 3 and subsection 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kim Embleton, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member, and designates her as vice-chair, of the Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries Development Board, representing the Department of Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fisheries and the Department of Energy and Resource Development, for a term of three years, effective July 16, 2019. 4. Under section 2 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following: (a) paragraphs 1(d) and (e) of Order in Council 2015-239 dated October 7, 2015; and (b) paragraph 1(a) of Order in Council 2016-116 dated May 25, 2016. 136 - 2 5. Under subsections 3(1 ), 3(2) and 4(1) of the Agricultural Development Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2018-45 dated January 30, 2018. o de,, a..
